moves.1. e4: Although I say it myself, I was quite pleased with my play in this game. I build up the pressure, find an interesting combination to win queen and pawn for rook and bishop and manage to convert the favourable ending.
moves.3. Be2: Quite playable, but rather unambitious. 3. d2-d4 is usual.
moves.6... g6: Intending to fianchetto, as in Pulkkinen, Kari (2316) vs. Kauppila, Osmo (2209)
moves.7. d4: I thought this was best for him, but 7. Ne4 was played in the above mentioned game.
moves.8... Nxc3: Played to weaken his queen side pawns.
moves.13... Qc7: Defending, but also threatening Rf-d8 with a powerful pin.
moves.15. Qd4+: He throws in a check. I think simply qe2 is better. Any views dear reader?
moves.16. Qc4: Attacking, and also offering the c2 pawn.
moves.16... Rfd8: I put my trust in development.
moves.17. Rac1: This seems a very passive move to me.
moves.17... Rab8: So I grab the other open file too.
moves.18. a4: I think this is wrong. I was expecting Rf-d1.
moves.21. Rc1: This again seems wrong, inviting my rook into the heart of his position.
moves.22... Qa5: Avoiding the queen exchange. I was rather expecting 23. Ra1 next.
moves.23... Qb6: Did you find it? Nasty attack on f2 and Rf1? is met with Bd3 winning.
moves.24. Be2: Find black's next move again dear reader.
moves.24... Bd3: Did you find it? After 25. Bxd3 he is mated, so....
moves.26... Qb2: and the problem for him is that he must lose a pawn too.
moves.28... e4: I push a potential passed pawn.
moves.29... Qd2: Played to try and prevent his rook becoming active.
moves.30. Rb1: With thoughts perhaps of becoming active on the b file?
moves.32... Qxe3: Mistake by me - I should have taken on h2.
moves.37... Kf6: I decide to try to advance in the centre of the board.
moves.48... h6: At last I advance my pawns.
moves.50. Rf3: Rook block. I wanted to play 50......g6-g5 but thought that he could defend with 51. Bd3 so....
moves.54... Qd4+: It is almost as if my queen wants to visit every square.
moves.60. Re2: His rook is now protected by his bishop.
moves.61... Qh1: He has to play carefully now to prevent the loss of the g pawn.
moves.65... f4: At last my pawn advances again.
moves.67. Bf1: This is a mistake, losing another pawn.
moves.67... Qc6: He can't save his a pawn.
moves.75. Bb3: He stops the a pawn from advancing.
moves.80... Kd4: And white resigns. One or other of the pawns is going to be promoted. Many thanks for reading. Please let me know how I am doing by leaving a comment or two and rating the annotation on the star system. Until next time dear reader!

players: Petru Floresc (ECF183) vs. Charles L Higgie (ECF180)
